result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Hogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or combination for fulltime.

Continue with AODA treatment program. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Sign all necessary releases.

Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by her agent. 
Submit DNA sample if not already done so.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court with attorney Benjamin John Krautkramer. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF422, 16CF5, 16CF6, 16CF195

11:46 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF5 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
16CF6 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF5, 16CF6.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF422 and 16CF195 are dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Krautkramer makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
16CF6 -
Sentence Withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
Continue with AODA treatment program. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Sign all necessary releases. 
Obtain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or combination for fulltime.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by her agent. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit DNA sample if not already done so. 

16CF5 -
180 days jail - STAYED -
First 90 days must be in jail.  Second 90 days can be on GPS monitoring if approved by jail administration and RISK assessment. 
Huber for employment, counseling and treatment.  
Placed on 36 months probation, concurrent: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 16CF6. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Any bond monies posted in any of the files shall be applied to the costs in these cases.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment at 03-14-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court with attorney Benjamin John Krautkramer. Defendant Amanda L Hogan in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases heard for initial appearances 16CF5 and 16CF6 then heard for preliminary along with 15CF422.

Initial Appearance Hearing on 16CF5 and 16CF6
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Preliminary Hearings on 15CF422, 16CF5 and 16CF6
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Informations have been filed and arraignment been set.

BTC: Bond in 15CF422 will cover cases 16CF5 & 16CF6  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
